question: Who was the first king of Israel?
explanation: Saul was anointed by Samuel as the first king of Israel, though he later fell from God's favor.

verses.kjv:
Then Samuel took a vial of oil, and poured
it upon his head, and kissed him, and said,
Is it not because the LORD hath anointed thee
to be captain over his inheritance?

question: Which king wrote most of the Proverbs?
explanation: Solomon, known for his wisdom, authored most of the book of Proverbs.

verses.kjv: The proverbs of Solomon the son of David, king of Israel;

question: Which king built the first temple in Jerusalem?
explanation: Solomon built the magnificent temple in Jerusalem using materials his father David had gathered.

verses.kjv:
And it came to pass in the four hundred and eightieth year after the children of Israel were come out of the land of Egypt, in the fourth year of Solomonâ€™s reign over Israel, in the month Zif, which
is the second month, that he began to build the house of the LORD.

question: Which king ordered all male Hebrew babies to be killed in Egypt?
explanation: Pharaoh ordered every Hebrew boy to be thrown into the Nile River to control the Israelite population.

verses.kjv: And Pharaoh charged all his people, saying, Every son that is born ye shall cast into the river, and every daughter ye shall save alive.

question: Which king was known for his great wisdom?
explanation: God gave Solomon wisdom and very great insight, and a breadth of understanding as measureless as the sand.

verses.kjv: Behold, I have done according to thy words: lo, I have given thee a wise and an understanding heart; so that there was none like thee before thee, neither after thee shall any arise like unto thee.

question: What did King Solomon ask God for?
explanation: Solomon asked for a discerning heart to govern the people and distinguish between right and wrong.

verses.kjv: Give therefore thy servant an understanding heart to judge thy people, that I may discern between good and bad: for who is able to judge this thy so great a people?

question: Which king sought to kill baby Jesus?
explanation: When Herod realized he had been outwitted, he ordered the killing of all boys in Bethlehem two years old and under.

verses.kjv: Then Herod, when he saw that he was mocked of the wise men, was exceeding wroth, and sent forth, and slew all the children that were in Bethlehem, and in all the coasts thereof, from two years old and under, according to the time which he had diligently enquired of the wise men.

question: Which king's heart was hardened against letting Israel go?
explanation: The Lord hardened Pharaoh's heart and he would not listen to Moses and Aaron.

verses.kjv: And the LORD hardened the heart of Pharaoh, and he hearkened not unto them; as the LORD had spoken unto Moses.

question: Which king put Daniel's three friends in the fiery furnace?
explanation: Nebuchadnezzar commanded mighty soldiers to bind Shadrach, Meshach, and Abednego and throw them in the furnace.

verses.kjv:
And he commanded the most mighty men that
were in his army to bind Shadrach, Meshach, and Abed-nego,
and to cast
them
 into the burning fiery furnace.

question: Who was the wisest man who ever lived?
explanation: God gave Solomon wisdom and very great insight, and a breadth of understanding.

verses.kjv: Behold, I have done according to thy words: lo, I have given thee a wise and an understanding heart; so that there was none like thee before thee, neither after thee shall any arise like unto thee.

question: Which king had a dream about a statue with different metals?
explanation: You looked, Your Majesty, and there before you stood a large statue with a head of gold.

verses.kjv:
Thou, O king, sawest, and behold a great image. This great image, whose brightness was excellent, stood before thee; and the form thereof
was
 terrible.

question: Who succeeded Moses as leader of Israel?
explanation: The Lord gave this command to Joshua: 'Be strong and courageous, for you will bring the Israelites into the land.'

verses.kjv: And he gave Joshua the son of Nun a charge, and said, Be strong and of a good courage: for thou shalt bring the children of Israel into the land which I sware unto them: and I will be with thee.

question: Which king was known for his many wives and concubines?
explanation: King Solomon had seven hundred wives of royal birth and three hundred concubines.

verses.kjv: And he had seven hundred wives, princesses, and three hundred concubines: and his wives turned away his heart.

question: Which king ordered all baby boys in Bethlehem killed?
explanation: When Herod realized he had been outwitted by the Magi, he gave orders to kill all the boys in Bethlehem.

verses.kjv: Then Herod, when he saw that he was mocked of the wise men, was exceeding wroth, and sent forth, and slew all the children that were in Bethlehem, and in all the coasts thereof, from two years old and under, according to the time which he had diligently enquired of the wise men.

question: Which king wrote most of the Psalms?
explanation: David, the shepherd king, wrote approximately 73 of the 150 Psalms in the Bible.

verses.kjv:
LORD, how are they increased that trouble me! many
are they that rise up against me.

question: Which king allowed the Jews to return to Jerusalem?
explanation: Cyrus king of Persia says: 'The Lord has appointed me to build a temple for Him at Jerusalem.'

verses.kjv:
Thus saith Cyrus king of Persia, The LORD God of heaven hath given me all the kingdoms of the earth; and he hath charged me to build him an house at Jerusalem, which
is in Judah.

question: Which king was the first king of Israel?
explanation: Samuel said to all the people, 'Do you see the man the Lord has chosen? There is no one like him among all the people.'

verses.kjv:
And Samuel said to all the people, See ye him whom the LORD hath chosen, that
there is none like him among all the people? And all the people shouted, and said, God save the king.

question: Which king was anointed by Samuel while he was still a boy?
explanation: So Samuel took the horn of oil and anointed him in the presence of his brothers, and from that day on the Spirit of the Lord came powerfully upon David.

verses.kjv: Then Samuel took the horn of oil, and anointed him in the midst of his brethren: and the Spirit of the LORD came upon David from that day forward. So Samuel rose up, and went to Ramah.

question: Which king threw Shadrach, Meshach, and Abednego into the fiery furnace?
explanation: He commanded some of the strongest soldiers in his army to tie up Shadrach, Meshach and Abednego and throw them into the blazing furnace.

verses.kjv:
And he commanded the most mighty men that
were in his army to bind Shadrach, Meshach, and Abed-nego,
and to cast
them
 into the burning fiery furnace.

question: Which king ordered all baby boys in Bethlehem to be killed?
explanation: When Herod realized that he had been outwitted by the Magi, he gave orders to kill all the boys in Bethlehem who were two years old and under.

verses.kjv: Then Herod, when he saw that he was mocked of the wise men, was exceeding wroth, and sent forth, and slew all the children that were in Bethlehem, and in all the coasts thereof, from two years old and under, according to the time which he had diligently enquired of the wise men.

question: Which king was the son of David and Bathsheba?
explanation: Then David comforted his wife Bathsheba, and he went to her and made love to her. She gave birth to a son, and they named him Solomon.

verses.kjv: And David comforted Bath-sheba his wife, and went in unto her, and lay with her: and she bare a son, and he called his name Solomon: and the LORD loved him.

question: Which king had Uriah killed to take his wife?
explanation: In the letter David wrote, 'Put Uriah out in front where the fighting is fiercest. Then withdraw from him so he will be struck down and die.'

verses.kjv: And he wrote in the letter, saying, Set ye Uriah in the forefront of the hottest battle, and retire ye from him, that he may be smitten, and die.

question: Who was Uriah's wife whom David took?
explanation: David sent someone to find out about her. The man said, 'She is Bathsheba, the daughter of Eliam and the wife of Uriah the Hittite.'

verses.kjv:
And David sent and enquired after the woman. And
one said,
Is not this Bath-sheba, the daughter of Eliam, the wife of Uriah the Hittite?

question: Which of David's sons rebelled against him?
explanation: Then Absalom sent secret messengers throughout the tribes of Israel to say, 'As soon as you hear the sound of the trumpets, then say, "Absalom is king in Hebron."'

verses.kjv: But Absalom sent spies throughout all the tribes of Israel, saying, As soon as ye hear the sound of the trumpet, then ye shall say, Absalom reigneth in Hebron.

question: Which king asked God for wisdom?
explanation: So give your servant a discerning heart to govern your people and to distinguish between right and wrong.

verses.kjv: Give therefore thy servant an understanding heart to judge thy people, that I may discern between good and bad: for who is able to judge this thy so great a people?

question: Which king asked God for wisdom instead of riches?
explanation: Solomon asked for a discerning heart to govern God's people and to distinguish between right and wrong.

verses.kjv: Give therefore thy servant an understanding heart to judge thy people, that I may discern between good and bad: for who is able to judge this thy so great a people?

question: Which king defeated Goliath before becoming king?
explanation: David triumphed over the Philistine with a sling and a stone; without a sword in his hand he struck down the Philistine and killed him.

verses.kjv:
So David prevailed over the Philistine with a sling and with a stone, and smote the Philistine, and slew him; but
there was no sword in the hand of David.
